00038 namespace nitf
00039 {
00040 
00047 class WriteHandler
00048 {
00049 public:
00050 
00052     virtual ~WriteHandler()
00053     {
00054     }
00055 
00060     virtual void write(IOInterface& handle) throw (nitf::NITFException) = 0;
00061 
00062     virtual nitf_WriteHandler* getNative() const
00063     {
00064         return cppWriteHandler;
00065     }
00066 
00067 private:
00069     static NITF_BOOL WriteHandler_write(NITF_DATA * data, nitf_IOInterface* io,
00070             nitf_Error *error);
00071 
00073     static void WriteHandler_destruct(NITF_DATA* data);
00074 
00075 protected:
00076 
00078     nitf_IWriteHandler getIWriteHandler()
00079     {
00080         // Create a data source interface that
00081         // the native layer can use
00082         nitf_IWriteHandler WriteHandler = { &WriteHandler_write,
00083                 &WriteHandler_destruct, };
00084         return WriteHandler;
00085     }
00086 
00088     WriteHandler() throw (nitf::NITFException);
00089 
00090     nitf_Error error;
00091     nitf_WriteHandler *cppWriteHandler;
00092 };
00093 
00098 class KnownWriteHandler: public WriteHandler
00099 {
00100 public:
00102     KnownWriteHandler() :
00103         WriteHandler(), knownHandler(NULL)
00104     {
00105     }
00106 
00108     virtual ~KnownWriteHandler()
00109     {
00110         //we don't destroy the native known WriteHandler - the Writer
00111         //destroys attached WriteHandlers - if you by chance don't attach
00112         //the handler to a Writer, you can call:
00113         //nitf_WriteHandler_destruct(handler->getNative());
00114         //but, we do need to delete the cppWriteHandler since it is not the
00115         //native one that DOES get deleted by the Writer
00116         if (cppWriteHandler)
00117             nitf_WriteHandler_destruct(&cppWriteHandler);
00118     }
00119 
00124     virtual void write(IOInterface& handle) throw (nitf::NITFException);
00125 
00126     nitf_WriteHandler* getNative() const
00127     {
00128         return knownHandler;
00129     }
00130 
00131 protected:
00132     nitf_WriteHandler *knownHandler;
00133 
00134     void setKnownHandler(nitf_WriteHandler *handler)
00135             throw (nitf::NITFException);
00136 };
00137 
00142 class StreamIOWriteHandler: public KnownWriteHandler
00143 {
00144 public:
00146     StreamIOWriteHandler(IOInterface& sourceHandle, nitf::Uint64 offset,
00147             nitf::Uint64 bytes);
00148     ~StreamIOWriteHandler()
00149     {
00150     }
00151 };

00157 class SegmentWriteHandler: public KnownWriteHandler
00158 {
00159 public:
00160     SegmentWriteHandler(SegmentReader reader) :
00161         mReader(reader)
00162     {
00163     }
00164 
00165     virtual ~SegmentWriteHandler()
00166     {
00167     }
00168 
00169     void write(IOInterface& handle) throw (nitf::NITFException);
00170

00173     static const size_t BLOCK_SIZE = 8192;
